meta.content: Get COVID-19-related info about school closures, at-home learning, free to-go meals and more.

div.h1: We may be apart because of COVID-19. But we’re in this together.

img.alt: Two joined hands form a handshake that looks like a heart.

div.h2: A comprehensive guide for EUSD families, teachers, staff, and community members.
div.h3: I know EUSD’s schools are physically closed. When will they reopen?

div.p: The Escondido Union School District and the San Diego County Office of Education continue to carefully monitor guidance from federal, state, and local public health and education agencies. Schools will reopen when state and health officials determine that it is safe to return. All decisions about reopening will be made in conjunction with local public health officials. The 2019–2020 school year is not over; it has just transitioned from classroom instruction into distance learning.

div.h3: What is the latest COVID-19-related news from EUSD?

div.p: In recent weeks, we’ve regularly emailed letters to families containing important updates. Those letters are also available on our Family Communications page.

div.h3: Are your schools still serving breakfast and lunch for students?

div.p: Yes. Free to-go meals (including breakfast and lunch) are being provided to all children age 18 and younger during COVID-19 school closures. Meals are available for pickup from 11 a.m. to 12 p.m Monday through Friday at eight schools. Visit our Free To-Go Meals page to learn more.

div.h3: I’m a parent. How do I ensure my child continues learning from home?

div.p: We have developed comprehensive digital resources for at-home learning. If you don’t have digital access, weekly paper study packets will be distributed at your child’s school on Fridays from 8:30 to 10:30 a.m.

div.h3: I’m the parent of a child with special needs. Are there additional at-home learning resources for Special Education?

div.p: Yes, we have created resources for Special Education. In addition, EUSD special education staff will be communicating with you regarding specific tools to meet your child’s individual education plan (to the extent feasible).

div.h3: I’m a teacher or staff member. What if I need help with my distance learning plan or technology?

div.p: Here are some links and resources you may find helpful (login to your eusd.org account required):

li.a: Get Distance Learning Resources from the EUSD Teacher Resources Site
View documentation related to Zoom, Communication, and Remote Instruction

ul.li:
For technology-related professional development support:
Visit “Our Most Popular Tutorials” page on the Teacher Resources Site, or contact a Tech TOSA at all_technology_tosas@eusd.org

br.a: Submit a ticket through the EUSD Web Help Desk

div.h3: I’m a community member looking for a job. Is EUSD still hiring?

div.p: Yes. In fact, there will be a number of open teacher, staff, and administrator opportunities available in the coming months. Visit our Careers page to learn more.
